theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on energy allocation trade-offs between somatic maintenance and reproduction, the core disposable soma concept of resource trade-offs.
Describes adaptive resource reallocation from reproduction to somatic maintenance under dietary restriction, fitting the resource allocation trade-off theme.
Emphasizes reproduction-lifespan trade-off mediated by resource allocation, consistent with disposable soma resource trade-off.
Describes trade-off between reproduction and maintenance under dietary restriction, highlighting resource allocation.
Resource reallocation hypothesis under dietary restriction, focusing on shifting resources from reproduction to somatic maintenance.
Discusses nutrient competition and resource allocation between reproduction and soma, consistent with disposable soma resource trade-off.
Focuses on resource allocation trade-offs and adaptive plasticity under dietary restriction, fitting the resource allocation theme.
Focuses on lifespan extension by caloric restriction and its mechanistic pathways, a specific dietary intervention under disposable soma.
Details calorie restriction effects on lifespan independent of protein intake, emphasizing caloric intake as driver of disposable soma effects.
Describes metabolic and hormonal modulation by caloric restriction leading to slowed aging, a mechanistic elaboration of CR under disposable soma.
Explores dietary restriction effects modulated by nutrient composition and hydration, refining caloric restriction mechanisms.
Focuses on IIS pathway nutrient sensing and lifespan regulation via DAF-16/FOXO, a conserved signaling mechanism under disposable soma.
Describes conserved IIS pathway regulating lifespan and stress resistance via DAF-16, a core insulin/IGF-1 signaling mechanism.
Details IIS pathway modulation of aging and neurodegeneration via FOXO, highlighting tissue-specific effects of insulin signaling.
Focuses on IIS pathway regulation of lifespan and neuroprotection via DAF-16, emphasizing stress resistance and cognitive health.
Describes reduced IIS extending lifespan through dauer-related and independent programs involving DAF-16 and SKN-1.
Covers IIS pathway components and their conserved role in lifespan regulation via DAF-16 transcription factor.
Details IIS pathway genes and epigenetic regulation affecting lifespan through DAF-16 and SKN-1.
Focuses on IIS pathway modulation by flavonoids and downstream DAF-16 activation, enhancing stress resistance and longevity.
Describes IIS pathway regulation of protein translation and lifespan extension via reduced signaling.
Covers conserved IIS signaling regulating lifespan and stress resistance via FOXO and other transcription factors.
Discusses IIS pathway's role in lifespan extension and muscle mass trade-offs, highlighting growth and metabolism regulation.
Emphasizes neuronal IIS signaling in lifespan regulation and stress resistance gene modulation.
Describes hormonal regulation of aging via IIS and DAF-16, including non-cell-autonomous signaling.
Focuses on genetic control of longevity through IIS and DAF-16 conserved across species.
Details IIS pathway's role in lifespan, immunity, and stress resistance via DAF-16/FOXO.
